channel.title: Introduction on Jellyfish Jabberings
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on Jellyfish Jabberings

item.title: About
item.description: About this site # I’m nearing my 4 year anniversary at Benchling and, in the tradition of an undergraduate thesis at the end of college, I thought it’d be worth writing up all of my learnings in a place where others can read them. The target audience for this is current Benchlings and ex-Benchlings, though there’s nothing company-sensitive or non-public on this site. What is your goal in writing this?

item.title: Organizational memory is very short
item.description: Organizational memory is very short # Median tenure at a tech company is about 2.5 years, and getting shorter. And while I think that’s generally good for employees, who can grow in their careers, compensation, and opportunities by switching roles frequently, it makes the companies themselves weaker. The best people for the job # It took me a long time to realize that the smartest technologists, the people who really know what they’re doing, they don’t often write in a public facing way where other people can read it.

item.title: Process over Speed is usually a mistake
